intro: Chrysosplenium album var. flavum, commonly known as the yellow waterleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Saxifragaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of elliptical, bright yellow leaves that are often covered in a fine white or grayish bloom. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its unique coloration and structure make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
